home.hero_description: Express your personality with a unique and colorful bracelet.

home.handmade_story:
Each bracelet is a promise ‚Äî the result of a slow, mindful gesture, woven by hand.
Where others produce, we create, thread by thread.
home.values_story_2:
Like a fingerprint, every bracelet is unique.
Its colors, knots, and shades tell your story.
home.values_story_3:
Fileor is a family.
A community of creative and curious souls who share a love for beauty and authenticity.
home.values_closing_quote: It‚Äôs not just a bracelet. It‚Äôs a piece of you, woven with the world.

home.testimonial1: The bracelets are stunning, and the quality is exceptional!

home.cta_title: Ready to create your own unique bracelet?

home.instagram_text: Get inspired by our creations and share your style.
home.handmade_text: Each Fileor creation is handcrafted with patience, precision, and love for detail. No machines ‚Äî only threads, beads, and endless creativity.
home.brazilian_text: Handwoven, a symbol of friendship and freedom. Wear them alone or stacked to express your personality.

home.atebas_text: Colorful threads wrapped around hair, a bohemian art form from South America, perfect for a free and festive look.

home.necklaces_text: Complete your look with matching necklaces and original creations made in your image.

about.title: Brazilian Bracelets & At√©bas
about.subtitle: A world of color, energy, and meaning you can wear.

bracelets.title: Brazilian Bracelets
bracelets.intro: Brazilian bracelets are more than simple accessories: they‚Äôre threads of friendship, luck, and freedom. Born in Latin America, they are worn as lucky charms. When you tie it, make a wish ‚Äî when it naturally falls off, your wish is said to come true.
bracelets.howTitle: How to tie a Brazilian bracelet?
bracelets.howDesc:
1Ô∏è‚É£ Place the bracelet around your wrist.
2Ô∏è‚É£ Ask someone to help you tie it.
3Ô∏è‚É£ Make a double knot ‚Äî tight but comfortable.
4Ô∏è‚É£ Cut the extra threads.
üí´ Think about your wish as you wear it, it will come true when the bracelet falls off.

atebas.title: At√©bas
atebas.intro: At√©bas (also called dread wraps) are colorful threads wrapped around a lock of hair. Rooted in hippie and ethnic cultures, they symbolize creativity and freedom. Each one is unique and can be decorated with beads or charms.
atebas.howDesc:
1Ô∏è‚É£ Separate a thin lock of hair.
2Ô∏è‚É£ Braid 2‚Äì3 cm at the root.
3Ô∏è‚É£ Wrap colored threads along the length.
4Ô∏è‚É£ Secure the end with a knot or bead.
To remove it, simply unwind the threads gently.
